docs.snippet: While Israelis have mixed views of Mr. Trump’s policy proposals, they admiringly describe him as “dugri,” a slang Hebrew term derived from the Arabic for “straight ahead.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: While Israelis have mixed views of Mr. Trump’s policy proposals, they admiringly describe him as “dugri,” a slang Hebrew term derived from the Arabic for “straight ahead.”
docs.abstract: Memo From Jerusalem; Republican presidential contender Donald J Trump has had less interaction with Israel than his Democratic opponent Hillary Rodham Clinton, but many Israelis appreciate his frankness.

headline.main: Israelis’ Favorite Thing About Donald Trump? His Style (to Put It Bluntly)
headline.print_headline: Israelis Are Divided on Trump’s Policies. His Main Allure: His Style (to Be Blunt).

docs.abstract: Peter Wehner Op-Ed article asserts evangelical Christian supporters of Donald J Trump are embracing candidate whose actions and perspective contradict Christianity; argues Trump's obsession with power and disdain for weak exemplify staunchly anti-Christian morality of Friedrich Nietzsche.

docs.snippet: We spend a lot of time trying to discern the inner lives of our presidential candidates, even though what we find is in the eye of the beholder....

docs.abstract: Jennifer Szalai First Words column examines America's demands for 'authenticity' in its politicians; holds shifting definition varies according to time period and individual opinion; notes Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump's struggles with authenticity in 2016 presidential election.

docs.abstract: Stephanie Rosenbloom travel article describes stay at string of hotels in New York, Miami and Las Vegas owned by presidential candidate Donald J Trump; observes Trump properties offer understated luxury that is at odds with his brash and outsize personality.
